description:
The distant future, 5012.
The sudden aerial invasion of Earth by ＜Aliens＞ and their creations ＜Machine Lifeforms＞led mankind to the brink of extinction. The surviving number of humans who took refuge on the moon to organize a counterattack using ＜android＞ soldiers to recapture Earth.

However, the war reaches a stalemate as the ＜Machine Lifeforms＞ continue to multiply infinitely. In turn, humanity deploys anew unit of android soldiers as an ultimate weapon: ＜YoRHa＞

Newly dispatched to Earth ＜2B＞ joins＜9S＞, the analyst currently stationed there, where amid their mission, they encounter a myriad of mysterious phenomena...

This is the story of these lifeless ＜androids＞ and their endless fight for the sake of mankind.

(Source: NieR:Automata Ver1.1a Official USA Website)

Note: Episodes 9, 10, 11, 12 aired back-to-back on July 23, 2023.
synonyms: ニーア オートマタ

node.description:
A Japanese video game director and scenario writer, having worked most notably at now-defunct game company Cavia. He became known for his work on the action role-playing video game series *Drakengard* and its spin-off *Nier*.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/yokotaro) | [Blog](http://yokotaro.blogspot.jp/) | [Facebook](http://www.facebook.com/yokotaro/)

A Japanese video game director and scenario writer, having worked most notably at now-defunct game company Cavia. He became known for his work on the action role-playing video game series *Drakengard* and its spin-off *Nier*.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/yokotaro) | [Blog](http://yokotaro.blogspot.jp/) | [Facebook](http://www.facebook.com/yokotaro/)

[Website](https://monaca.jp/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/MONACA_jp)

__MONACA__ is a Japanese music production studio, which was established by the composer Keiichi Okabe in October 2004.

__Members__:
• [Keiichi Okabe](https://anilist.co/staff/121585/Keiichi-Okabe) (CEO)
• [Satoru Kousaki](https://anilist.co/staff/101555/Satoru-Kousaki)
• [Ryuuichi Takada](https://anilist.co/staff/109459/Ryuuichi-Takada)
• [Kakeru Ishihama](https://anilist.co/staff/150946/Kakeru-Ishihama)
• [Hidekazu Tanaka](https://anilist.co/staff/141852/Hidekazu-Tanaka)
• [Keiichi Hirokawa](https://anilist.co/staff/156490/Keiichi-Hirokawa)
• [Kuniyuki Takahashi](https://anilist.co/staff/154774/Kuniyuki-Takahashi)
• [Shuotarou Seo](https://anilist.co/staff/317330/Shoutarou-Seo)
• [Oliver Good](https://anilist.co/staff/317296)
• [Keita Inoue](https://anilist.co/staff/229376/Keita-Inoue)

__Past Members__:
• [Yuri Mitsumi](https://anilist.co/staff/201236/Yuri-Misumi)
• [Keigo Hoashi](https://anilist.co/staff/111233/Keigo-Hoashi)

[Official Website](https://www.hrg116.com) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/_m.hrg_/) | [Nico Nico Douga](https://www.nicovideo.jp/user/14605359/mylist?ref=pc_userpage_menu)

Mie Hiraga is an animation producer. She currently works on video production with motion graphics elements.

He is an art director and supervisor, who was a long time member of Bihou until 2007 when he went to head the background art department in Totonyan. He belongs to the anime production group Neko-Nanban-Tei together with director Watanabe Takashi and his wife Miyata Naomi.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/tk_mogi)

Color designer who works frequently with [A-1 Pictures](https://anilist.co/studio/561/A1-Pictures).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/106669804) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/amazarashiofficial) | [Website](http://www.amazarashi.com)

A mysterious band led by singer [Hiromu Akita](https://anilist.co/staff/159938).

[Website](http://www.aimer-web.jp/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/aimer_and_staff) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/aimer_0907_official/) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCR1zT1s524Hbc85bdvno_8w)

A Japanese pop singer and lyricist signed to SME Records and managed by FOURseam. Her name comes from the verb "aimer" in French which means "to love." She is known for being a faceless voice. She very rarely appears on her music videos and most of her live performances are dimly lit to obscure her face. She finally revealed herself on the August 20, 2016 episode of Music Station.

Her father was the bassist of a band, so Aimer grew up surrounded by music from a very young age. She began studying the piano in elementary school and highly looked up to Ringo Sheena and Utada Hikaru. In junior high school, listening to Avril Lavigne inspired her to take up guitar and began writing English lyrics. At the age of 15, Aimer lost her voice due to over-usage of her vocal cords and was forced to undergo silence therapy for treatment. However, that did not stop her, and after she recovered, she acquired her distinctive husky voice.

Aimer teamed up with the "Agehasprings" group, which has worked with, produced, or provided music for various artists, including Yuki, Mika Nakashima, Flumpool, Superfly, Yuzu, and Genki Rockets. In 2011, her musical career began in earnest. In May 2011, they released the concept album "Your Favorite Things." It covered numerous popular works, including works in various genre such as jazz and country western music.

Married [Masahiro Tobinai](https://anilist.co/staff/146979/Masahiro-Tobinai) in 2023.
